page.title: 11INTERVIEW RESIDENT
page.content: MRS. HEANEY, WHO WORKS IN OUR SCHOOL, HAS LIVED IN CUMBERNAULD A LONG TIME. WE ASKED HER TO TELL US WHAT CUMBERNAULD USED TO BE LIKE. SHE CAME TO THE TOWN IN OCT. 1961. SHE WAS PLEASED WITH HER NEW HOME IN KILDRUM BECAUSE OF THE GOOD KITCHEN, BATHROOM AND ALL THE PLANTS AROUND HER. TWENTY FOUR YEARS AGO ALL THE HOUSES WERE IN AFTON ROAD. WHEN A BUS CAME FROM GLASGOW, IT CAME TO AFTON ROAD AND TURNED RIGHT BACK TO GLASGOW. THE ONLY SHOP WAS A "SPAR" AND THAT WAS USED AS A POST OFFICE AS WELL. A VAN CAME ROUND WITH GROCERIES. THERE WAS NO BANK. SACRED HEART PRIMARY WAS THERE BUT NOT THE CHURCH.THE Y.M.C.A. WAS BESIDE THE SCHOOL BUT WAS UNUSED AT THAT TIME. WE ASKED MRS. HEANEY IF SHE STILL LIKED CUMBERNAULD. SHE SAID THAT SHE LIKED THE LANDSCAPING BUT THE LITTER MADE IT WORSE.
